intro: Phyllanthus casticum subsp. angavensis, commonly known as the Angavensis spurge, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
